subject: Productivity
title: Inversion Thinking
description: Learn Inversion Thinking in one minute.

hook.text: Charlie Munger says: tell me where I'm going to die, so I never go there.

buildup.text: Inversion thinking flips the problem. Instead of asking how to succeed, ask how to guarantee failure.

discovery.text: Carl Jacobi, a mathematician, used this method: invert, always invert. Solve problems backward.

twist.text: Avoiding stupidity is easier and more reliable than seeking brilliance. Inversion targets the former.

climax.text: List everything that would make a project fail. Then do the opposite. Simple and powerful.

punchline.text: Avoid the worst outcomes. The good ones find you.

quiz.question: What is inversion thinking?
options: Solving problems by considering how to guarantee failure first
Always following the most popular approach
Making decisions purely based on intuition
